criteria: Ability to write routinely for extended periods, showing reflection and revision.
Awareness and adjustment for different purposes and audiences.
descriptions: The student shows no evidence of routine writing or reflection.
The student attempts to write routinely but demonstrates minimal reflection or revision.
The student writes routinely for short periods, with limited evidence of reflection and revision.
The student writes routinely for extended periods, showing some reflection and minor revisions.
The student writes routinely, showing clear reflection and thoughtful revisions to improve their work.
The student consistently writes routinely over extended time, demonstrating deep reflection, significant revisions, and a commitment to improving their writing through iterative processes.
The student does not attempt discipline-specific tasks.
The student struggles significantly with discipline-specific tasks.
The student attempts discipline-specific tasks but demonstrates a lack of understanding of the requirements.
The student adequately completes discipline-specific tasks, meeting basic requirements.
The student effectively completes discipline-specific tasks, demonstrating a good understanding of the requirements and some independent thought.
The student expertly adapts to and completes a variety of discipline-specific tasks, demonstrating a deep understanding of the requirements and offering insightful, original work.
The student shows no awareness of purpose or audience in their writing.
The student's writing is inappropriate for the intended purpose or audience.
The student shows a limited understanding of how to tailor their writing for different purposes or audiences.
The student makes some adjustments to their writing based on purpose and audience, but these are superficial.
The student effectively tailors their writing for different purposes and audiences, demonstrating a strong understanding of rhetorical strategies.
The student skillfully crafts their writing to suit different purposes and audiences, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of rhetorical strategies and achieving a powerful, engaging effect.
